title: Nalzok
html:
Nalzok

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
& Nalzok
Difficulty 23
Attacks Weapon 8d4, weapon 4d6, spell-casting, claw quest-artifact-stealing 2d6
& Nalzok
Difficulty 23
Attacks

Weapon 8d4, weapon 4d6, spell-casting, claw quest-artifact-stealing 2d6

Base level 16
Base experience 585
Speed 12
Base AC −2
Base MR 85
Alignment −127 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances Fire, poison, stoning
Resistances conveyed None

Nalzok:

  • can fly.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a demon.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • wants your quest artifact.
  • waits for you to come.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference monst.c#line3267

Nalzok, &, is the Priest quest nemesis. He is a unique major demon who guards the Bell of Opening and the Priest quest artifact, The Mitre of Holiness. Nalzok is almost identical to the Minion of Huhetotl, the Archeologist quest nemesis, save for his far stronger chaotic alignment and his slightly higher monster MR.

Nalzok has two strong weapon attacks, the ability to cast mage monster spells, and a claw attack that can steal back the quest artifact if the hero has taken it. Nalzok possesses fire resistance, poison resistance, the drain resistance and death resistance of all demons, and the stoning resistance of all quest nemeses.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit fe34d4e3, Nalzok will leave behind a mass of poison clouds upon death. Per commit 8b9a93f7 the player will not be blamed for damage done by poison clouds from killing a quest nemesis.

Generation

Nalzok is generated on one of two squares in the midst of his lair on the goal level of the Priest quest, with the Bell of Opening and The Mitre of Holiness underneath him.

Strategy

Since Nalzok is almost identical to the Minion of Huhetotl, some of the strategies that apply there will also apply to him: Nalzok hates silver and respects Elbereth and a grounded scroll of scare monster, and can summon nasties much like the Minion. Nalzok can also inflict very large amounts of damage with his two weapon attacks and spellcasting (which includes drain strength and destroy armor).

Clearing the surrounding area of monsters beforehand should be easier in comparison to the Minion's crypt, especially with the #turn command making short work of most of the zombies and wraiths - note that he can wake up early and get a few swings in during the short period of vulnerability. An AC of around −15 with a source of magic resistance is advisable, as is the usual strategy of standing on/blocking/teleporting to the upstair, then awakening and engaging Nalzok there - be mindful of the lava plain and the fire traps during the fight, as one misstep can easily end the game.

A blessed and enchanted artifact weapon (e.g. Frost Brand, Grayswandir, Magicbane, etc.) at Basic skill or a similarly blessed and enchanted silver weapon at Skilled or higher should be enough to make the fight against Nalzok easier - priests should have no shortage of holy water to bless both the weapon and enchant weapon scrolls with.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The scroll of scare monster on the ground no longer scares any unique monster.

Encyclopedia entry

Nalzok is Moloch's cunning and unfailingly loyal battle
lieutenant, to whom he trusts the command of warfare when he
does not wish to exercise it himself. Nalzok is a major
demon, known to command the undead. He is hungry for power,
and secretly covets Moloch's position. Moloch doesn't trust
him, but, trusting his own power enough, chooses to allow
Nalzok his position because he is useful.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Nalzok&oldid=177019"

{{questmon|Nalzok|Priest|nemesis}} He is a [[unique]] [[major demon]] who guards the [[Bell of Opening]] and the Priest [[quest artifact]], [[The Mitre of Holiness]]. Nalzok is almost identical to the [[Minion of Huhetotl]], the [[Archeologist quest]] nemesis, save for his far stronger chaotic alignment and his slightly higher [[Magic resistance (monster)|monster MR]].

Nalzok has two strong weapon attacks, the ability to cast mage [[monster spell]]s, and a claw attack that can steal back the quest artifact if the [[hero]] has taken it. Nalzok possesses [[fire resistance]], [[poison resistance]], the [[drain resistance]] and [[death resistance]] of all demons, and the [[stoning resistance]] of all quest nemeses.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|fe34d4e3e37cc2002e1473e10a96cade16150366}}, Nalzok will leave behind a mass of [[poison cloud]]s upon death. Per {{commit|8b9a93f797eb52f611f9cb682b9d68311c8dbbdc}} the player will not be blamed for damage done by poison clouds from killing a quest nemesis.}}

==Generation==
Nalzok is generated on one of two squares in the midst of his lair on the goal level of the [[Priest quest]], with the Bell of Opening and The Mitre of Holiness underneath him.

==Strategy==
Since Nalzok is almost identical to the Minion of Huhetotl, some of the strategies that apply there will also apply to him: Nalzok hates silver and respects [[Elbereth]] and a grounded [[scroll of scare monster]], and can [[summon nasties]] much like the Minion. Nalzok can also inflict very large amounts of damage with his two weapon attacks and spellcasting (which includes [[drain strength]] and [[destroy armor (monster spell)|destroy armor]]).

Clearing the surrounding area of monsters beforehand should be easier in comparison to the Minion's crypt, especially with the #[[Turn undead|turn]] [[Extended command|command]] making short work of most of the [[Zombie (monster class)|zombies]] and [[wraith (monster class)|wraiths]] - note that he can wake up early and get a few swings in during the short period of vulnerability. An AC of around −15 with a source of [[magic resistance]] is advisable, as is the usual strategy of standing on/blocking/teleporting to the upstair, then awakening and engaging Nalzok there - be mindful of the lava plain and the fire traps during the fight, as one misstep can easily end the game.

A blessed and enchanted artifact weapon (e.g. [[Frost Brand]], [[Grayswandir]], [[Magicbane]], etc.) at Basic skill or a similarly blessed and enchanted silver weapon at Skilled or higher should be enough to make the fight against Nalzok easier - priests should have no shortage of [[holy water]] to bless both the weapon and {{scroll of|enchant weapon}} scrolls with.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|The scroll of scare monster on the ground no longer scares any unique monster.}}
